title: Traditional Dishes of Costa Rica
shortDescription: A flavorful journey through Costa Rica‚Äôs most traditional dishes.
longDescription: Costa Rican cuisine is a tapestry of Indigenous, Spanish, Afro-Caribbean, and mestizo influences, built on fresh, wholesome ingredients like corn, beans, plantains, and a diversity of native fruits and vegetables. From hearty stews and rice-and-bean breakfasts to refreshing seafood and unique sweets, these dishes are the essence of Costa Rican culinary identity, served in homes, sodas, and festivals alike.
